column4: anyone know of a repository i can add to ubuntu 11.1 to get ancient nvidia drivers?
i need nvidia-71 or legacy drivers,, the oldest in 11.1 is nvidia-96 :(
i can but i read on the ubuntu wiki site and forums that its not good or doesnt work by downloading them
if all you need is one driver go to the package site and get the deb then use dpkg to install it.
what was the last version you had it on?
you would mess up everything related to updates and dependencies
follow the url directions: yes you have to download the driver plus linux module headers fro the repos you have.
download the driver from there, yes
it's a program from Nvidia that makes and installs, configures a driver for you.
I beleive the program runs and needs an internet connection to get the driver from Nvidia.com or whereever.
and also it compiles the drive module but it needs linux module headers or linux kernel source. It's simpler to just get the header files unless you are going to be compiling kernels.
kernel headers have to be installed before the Nvidia install.sh can run.
